e13f7bf02b985dfdce3ab29a5df74ca2fb15b25d.answer: Barcelona can be visited off-season and is a lovely city even in the winter months of January and February, as long as the possibility of rain is low. Given the high humidity, temperatures from 19 to 23°C are considered comfortable weather, which is usually the temperature from May to June, and from late August to October. These are the best times to visit the city. Anything warmer than this can feel too hot, and the period from November to April is quite chilly and at times gloomy [1].

5ef8602bb407f70cad9563da37c8717695051618.answer: In the southern hemisphere, the Southern Lights or Aurora Australis can be observed several times a year in particular locations. Tasmania and the South Island of New Zealand are places where the Lights can be seen. If conditions are right, Hobart and Invercargill offer the best chance in places that are quickly accessible from within Australia and New Zealand. Although Christchurch has a geographic latitude south of Hobart, its "geomagnetic latitude" is further north, and aurora there are no more likely than southern Victoria [1].

4f349238ca6045eba01d876d44bb52afb1940cb0.answer: In the southern hemisphere, the Southern Lights can be observed several times a year in places like Tasmania and the South Island of New Zealand. Hobart and Invercargill offer the best chances for viewing the lights in locations that are quickly accessible from within Australia and New Zealand. However, these locations are still outside the auroral belt itself, so the odds of catching the lights during a trip there are not high. The best place to view them would be Antarctica's Ross Sea via Macquarie Island (Australia) or the New Zealand Subantarctic Islands, with the best viewing from a boat. Stewart Island is the closest island to the auroral belt that has a good range of tourist accommodation [1].
